sect1.title: PCI Utilities-&pciutils-version;

sect2.title: Installation of PCI Utilities
sect2.para: Install PCI Utilities by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: make PREFIX=/usr MANDIR=/usr/share/man \ ZLIB=no SHARED=yes PCI_COMPRESSED_IDS=0 all

sect2.para: This package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput: make PREFIX=/usr MANDIR=/usr/share/man \ ZLIB=no SHARED=yes PCI_COMPRESSED_IDS=0 \ install install-lib

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: ZLIB=no: This parameter prevents compression of the pci.ids file.
SHARED=yes: This parameter enables building of shared library instead of static one.
PCI_COMPRESSED_IDS=0: This parameter ensures that compression won't be used when updating pci.ids.

sect2.title: Configuring PCI Utilities
sect2.para: The pci.ids data file is constantly being updated. To get a current version of this file, run update-pciids as the root user. This program requires the script or program to find , or which are used to download the most current file, and then replace the existing file in /usr/share.
You may wish to add an entry to root's (or any other user who has write privilege to /usr/share) crontab to automatically update the pci.ids file periodically.
